text: Andreï Svetchine, also known as André Svétchine, (1912–1996) was a Russian- born French architect.Luc Svétchine, André Svétchine, Regard d'un architecte sur son œuvre, Gilletta-Nice Matin, 2010, . Svetchine was born in Saint Petersburg and died in Nice. == Works== * Villa of Marc Chagall in Saint-Jean- Cap-Ferrat (1949) * Mill in Mougins for Raymonde Zehnaker (1951–1952) * Château de La Colle Noire in Montauroux for Christian Dior (1955–1957) * Fernand Léger Museum in Biot (1957–1960) * Villa of Marc Chagall in Saint- Paul-de-Vence (1964–1966) * Villa of brewer Heineken in Cap d'Antibes (1965–1966) == Restorations == * Colombe d'Or in Saint-Paul-de-Vence (1949–1950) * Orthodox Cathedral in Nice == References== Category:1912 births Category:1996 deaths Category:People from Saint Petersburg Category:20th- century French architects
title: Andreï Svetchine
